title: Google\Cloud\Batch\V1\Runnable
name: Runnable
description:
Runnable describes instructions for executing a specific script or container as part of a Task.

Generated from protobuf message google.cloud.batch.v1.Runnable

Extends Google\Protobuf\Internal\Message

params.name: data
params.description: Optional. Data for populating the Message object.

params.name: data.ignore_exit_status
params.description: Normally, a non-zero exit status causes the Task to fail. This flag allows execution of other Runnables to continue instead.

params.name: data.background
params.description: This flag allows a Runnable to continue running in the background while the Task executes subsequent Runnables. This is useful to provide services to other Runnables (or to provide debugging support tools like SSH servers).

params.name: data.always_run
params.description: By default, after a Runnable fails, no further Runnable are executed. This flag indicates that this Runnable must be run even if the Task has already failed. This is useful for Runnables that copy output files off of the VM or for debugging. The always_run flag does not override the Task's overall max_run_duration. If the max_run_duration has expired then no further Runnables will execute, not even always_run Runnables.

params.name: data.environment
params.description: Environment variables for this Runnable (overrides variables set for the whole Task or TaskGroup).

methods.name: getAlwaysRun
methods.description:
By default, after a Runnable fails, no further Runnable are executed. This flag indicates that this Runnable must be run even if the Task has already failed. This is useful for Runnables that copy output files off of the VM or for debugging.

The always_run flag does not override the Task's overall max_run_duration. If the max_run_duration has expired then no further Runnables will execute, not even always_run Runnables.

Generated from protobuf field bool always_run = 5;

The always_run flag does not override the Task's overall max_run_duration. If the max_run_duration has expired then no further Runnables will execute, not even always_run Runnables.

Generated from protobuf field bool always_run = 5;
